results.details:
√σ derivation chain test:

R_stella = 0.44847 fm (framework input)
√σ = ℏc/R = 440.00 MeV (Prop 0.0.17j)

Comparison:
  FLAG 2024: √σ = 439.0 ± 8.0 MeV
  Framework: √σ = 440.00 MeV
  Deviation: 0.23% (0.13σ)

NOTE: This is CIRCULAR — R_stella was chosen to match √σ ≈ 440 MeV.
The genuine test is flux tube width consistency (test_r_stella_from_flux_tube).

f_π derivation test:

√σ = 440.00 MeV (from R_stella)
f_π = √σ/(N_c + N_f) = 440.00/5 = 88.00 MeV

Comparison:
  PDG 2024: f_π = 92.07 ± 0.57 MeV
  Framework: f_π = 88.00 MeV
  Deviation: 4.42% (7.1σ)

The factor 1/5 = 1/(N_c + N_f) is DERIVED from broken generator counting.
The 5% discrepancy is attributed to one-loop radiative corrections.

GENUINE PREDICTION: The factor 1/5 is not fitted — it comes from:
  (N_c - 1) + (N_f² - 1) = 2 + 3 = 5 for N_c=3, N_f=2

Gatto relation test:

PDG 2024: m_d = 4.7 ± 0.07 MeV, m_s = 93.5 ± 0.8 MeV
√(m_d/m_s) = 0.22420 ± 0.00193

Geometric λ = (1/φ³)×sin(72°) = 0.22451

Deviation: 0.138% (0.16σ)

GENUINE PREDICTION: The geometric formula uses:
  φ = (1+√5)/2 (golden ratio)
  72° (pentagon internal angle)

Neither depends on quark masses — this is a pure geometric prediction!

Strange/down mass ratio test:

PDG 2024: m_s/m_d = 19.89 ± 0.34

Framework prediction:
  λ = 0.22451
  m_s/m_d = 1/λ² = 19.84

Deviation: 0.28% (0.16σ)

This is equivalent to the Gatto relation but expressed as a ratio.

Muon/electron mass ratio test:

PDG 2024: m_μ/m_e = 206.76828 (very precise)

Framework decomposition:
  λ^(-2) = 19.84 (PREDICTED from geometry)
  c_μ/c_e = 10.422 (EXTRACTED from data)

Framework claimed: c_μ/c_e ≈ 10.4
  Predicted ratio = 206.32

Deviation: 0.216%

NOTE: The λ^(-2) factor is PREDICTED; c_μ/c_e is FITTED/EXTRACTED.
The genuine prediction is that the ratio has the form λ^(-2) × O(10).

Base mass derivation check:

Step-by-step computation:
  g_χ = 4π/9 = 1.3963
  ω = √σ/(N_c-1) = 220.00 MeV
  Λ = 4πf_π = 1105.84 MeV
  v_χ = f_π = 88.00 MeV

m_base = (g_χ × ω / Λ) × v_χ
       = (1.3963 × 220.00 / 1105.84) × 88.00
       = 24.44 MeV

Proposition states: m_base = 24.4 MeV
Deviation: 0.18%

This verifies internal consistency of the P2 parameter chain.

c_d ≈ c_s prediction test:

PDG masses: m_d = 4.7 MeV, m_s = 93.5 MeV
Base mass: m_base = 24.44 MeV

Extracted η_f:
  η_d = m_d/m_base = 0.1923
  η_s = m_s/m_base = 3.8250

Decomposition (η_f = λ^(2n) × c_f):
  λ = 0.22451
  λ^4 = 0.002541 (1st gen)
  λ^2 = 0.05041 (2nd gen)

Extracted c_f:
  c_d = η_d / λ^4 = 75.67
  c_s = η_s / λ^2 = 75.88

c_d/c_s = 0.9972
Deviation from equality: 0.28%

GENUINE PREDICTION: The framework predicts c_d ≈ c_s because they
have the same isospin (down-type quarks in different generations).

Sensitivity analysis:

R_stella variations:
  Central: R = 0.44847 fm → f_π = 88.00 MeV
  +2σ:     R = 0.46 fm → f_π = 85.79 MeV
  -2σ:     R = 0.44 fm → f_π = 89.69 MeV

Relative changes:
  ΔR/R = ±2.2%
  Δf_π/f_π = ±2.2%

Sensitivity ratio: (Δf_π/f_π) / (ΔR/R) = 0.99

Expected: ~1.0 (linear propagation since f_π ∝ 1/R)
Actual: 0.99

The framework predictions are STABLE under R_stella variations.

EW sector heavy quark test:

EW base mass:
  m_base_EW = (g_χ × ω_EW / Λ_EW) × v_EW
            = (1.396 × 125000 / 1000000) × 246000
            = 42935 MeV = 42.9 GeV

Extracted η_f (= m_f / m_base_EW):
  η_c = 0.0296
  η_b = 0.0974
  η_t = 4.02

Extracted c_f (η_f = λ^(2n) × c_f):
  c_c = η_c / λ² = 0.587 (2nd gen)
  c_b = η_b / 1 = 0.097 (3rd gen)
  c_t = η_t / 1 = 4.02 (3rd gen)

NOTE: Λ_EW = 1 TeV is FITTED to match heavy quark masses.
This is NOT a prediction — the c_f values and Λ_EW are phenomenological.

The genuine test is whether c_t ~ O(1), which corresponds to y_t ~ 1.

Parameter counting:

Framework parameters (free):
  QCD sector: 2 (R_stella, c_u)
  EW sector: 8 (ω_EW, v_EW, Λ_EW, c_t, c_b/c_t, c_τ, c_μ/c_τ, c_e/c_μ)
  Neutrino: 1 (M_R)
  Total: 11

Constrained (not free):
  λ: derived from φ and 72°
  g_χ, ω, f_π, v_χ, Λ: derived from R_stella
  c_d/c_u: constrained by Gatto relation
  c_s/c_d: constrained ≈ 1 (same isospin)
  c_c/c_t: constrained by λ² suppression

Standard Model parameters: 20

Reduction: (20 - 11) / 20 = 45%

HONEST ASSESSMENT: The 45% reduction is genuine, but most predictive
power comes from the QCD sector. The EW sector has many fitted parameters.

what_is_fitted: Heavy quark and lepton η_f values
summary.honest_assessment: The QCD sector has genuine predictive power (Gatto relation, c_f patterns). The EW sector is largely phenomenological with many fitted parameters. The 45% parameter reduction is real but comes mainly from QCD constraints.
